title: Authors and Citation
text: Kulma K, Voigt S (2026). lobsteR: Access Process LOBSTER high-frequency data. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/voigtstefan/lobster.
code: @Manual{,   title = {lobsteR: Access and Process LOBSTER high-frequency data},   author = {Karol Kulma and Stefan Voigt},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/voigtstefan/lobster}, }

what: Access and Process LOBSTER high-frequency data
title: Access and Process LOBSTER high-frequency data
text: goal lobsteR provide tidy framework request data lobsterdata.com, download, unzip, clean data. package focuses core functionalities required get LOBSTER data ready fast, subsequent typical high-frequency econometrics applications, refer highfrequency package. Install package (development version): can install development version lobsteR GitHub :

what: Request and download data from lobsterdata.com
title: Access and Process LOBSTER high-frequency data
text: lobsteR can connect easily connect lobsterdata.com using credentials. recommend store credentials .Renviron file avoid hardcoding scripts. Next, request data lobsterdata.com, e.g., message-level data META period May 1st, 2023 May 3rd, 2023. ´level´ corresponds requested number orderbook snapshot levels. Next, submit requests LOBSTER (server process ; can take time): submitting request, lobsterdata.com work providing order book snapshots. Depending number messages process, may take time. can close session time, processing done background servers Lobster. done, requested data available account archive - ready download! downloading, data unzipped automatically (can omitted using unzip = FALSE)
code: library(lobsteR) lobster_login <- account_login(   login = Sys.getenv("user"), # replace with your username   pwd   = Sys.getenv("pwd")   # replace with your password ) #> # Login on lobsterdata.com successful data_request <- request_query(   symbol = "MSFT",   start_date = "2025-05-01",   end_date = "2025-05-15",   level = 10)  data_request #>    symbol start_date   end_date level #> 1    MSFT 2025-05-01 2025-05-01    10 #> 2    MSFT 2025-05-02 2025-05-02    10 #> 5    MSFT 2025-05-05 2025-05-05    10 #> 6    MSFT 2025-05-06 2025-05-06    10 #> 7    MSFT 2025-05-07 2025-05-07    10 #> 8    MSFT 2025-05-08 2025-05-08    10 #> 9    MSFT 2025-05-09 2025-05-09    10 #> 12   MSFT 2025-05-12 2025-05-12    10 #> 13   MSFT 2025-05-13 2025-05-13    10 #> 14   MSFT 2025-05-14 2025-05-14    10 #> 15   MSFT 2025-05-15 2025-05-15    10 request_submit(account_login = lobster_login,                request = data_request) lobster_archive <- account_archive(account_login = lobster_login) data_download(   requested_data = lobster_archive |> filter(symbol == "MSFT"),   account_login = lobster_login,   path = "data-lobster")

what: Data processing on an Unix system
title: Access and Process LOBSTER high-frequency data
text: unzip data, lobsteR relies archive package , turn, requires couple system dependencies installed. Debian-based linux system, can install required dependencies using following commands:
code: sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install -y gpgv gnupg libarchive13t64 liblz4-dev libacl1-dev libext2fs-dev nettle-dev sudo apt-get install -y libarchive-dev

what: Retrieve LOBSTER data archive information — account_archive
title: Retrieve LOBSTER data archive information — account_archive
text: Fetches information available datasets LOBSTER account archive. includes details symbols, date ranges, order book levels, file sizes, download links available dataset.

title: Retrieve LOBSTER data archive information — account_archive
Retrieve LOBSTER data archive information — account_archive
text: account_login List object returned account_login. Must contain valid authenticated session.

title: Retrieve LOBSTER data archive information — account_archive
text: tibble information available archive data: id Integer. Unique identifier dataset symbol Character. Stock/ETF ticker symbol (e.g., "SPY", "AAPL") start_date Date. First date data coverage end_date Date. Last date data coverage level Integer. Order book depth level (number price levels) size Integer. File size bytes download Character. Direct download URL dataset

title: Retrieve LOBSTER data archive information — account_archive
text: function: Validates provided account login successful Navigates data archive page Scrapes archive table extracts download links Processes cleans data structured format Filters empty datasets (size = 0) Orders results ID descending order (recent first) datasets non-zero file sizes returned. download URLs can used directly data_download similar functions.

title: Retrieve LOBSTER data archive information — account_archive
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Login and get archive info my_account <- account_login("user@example.com", "password") archive_info <- account_archive(my_account)  # View available datasets print(archive_info)  # Get SPY datasets only spy_data <- archive_info[archive_info$symbol == "SPY", ] } # }

title: Authenticate with LOBSTER account — account_login
text: Logs LOBSTER account creates session object subsequent data requests. function handles authentication process lobsterdata.com validates login successful.

title: Authenticate with LOBSTER account — account_login
Authenticate with LOBSTER account — account_login
text: login character(1) Email address associated LOBSTER account. pwd character(1) Account password.

title: Authenticate with LOBSTER account — account_login
text: list containing authentication details: valid Logical indicating login successful session httr session object authenticated session submission httr response object login submission named list components: valid logical(1) — TRUE authentication succeeded. session rvest session object used navigation. submission rvest response returned sign-form submitted.

title: Authenticate with LOBSTER account — account_login
text: function performs form-based authentication : Creating session LOBSTER sign-page Filling submitting login form Validating response URL confirm successful authentication successful login redirects request data page. returned object passed functions like account_archive request_submit. function submits sign-form using AJAX header (x-requested-: XMLHttpRequest) confirms success checking redirect URL. Network connectivity valid credentials required.

title: Authenticate with LOBSTER account — account_login
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Login to LOBSTER account my_account <- account_login("user@example.com", "mypassword")  # Check if login was successful if (my_account$valid) {   message("Successfully logged in!") } } # }  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ acct <- account_login("you@example.com", "your-password") if (acct$valid) {   archive <- account_archive(acct) } } # }

title: Download requested archive files — data_download
text: Download one files listed requested_data using authenticated session account_login. Files written path. Downloads occur calling R process file write optional extraction performed background R process (via callr::r_bg). unzip = TRUE original archive removed extraction.

title: Download requested archive files — data_download
Download requested archive files — data_download
text: requested_data data.frame tibble archive metadata must include minimum download column (full download URL) id column used tracking. account_login list Output account_login() containing authenticated session used fetch file content. path character(1) Filesystem path downloaded files written (unzip = TRUE) extracted. path must already exist. unzip logical(1) TRUE (default) extract downloaded .7z archive using archive::archive_extract delete archive file afterwards.

title: Download requested archive files — data_download
text: Invisibly returns NULL. Side effects: files written path background processes spawned perform file writes / extraction.

title: Download requested archive files — data_download
text: function uses rvest::session_jump_to() request download URL launches background R process write binary content optionally extract . function silent progress returns invisibly; background processes left running callr.

what: Validate a generated request (remove weekends, holidays, existing files) — .request_validate
title: Validate a generated request (remove weekends, holidays, existing files) — .request_validate
text: Internal helper used request_query(). Removes weekend days (Saturday Sunday) NYSE holidays years present request_query. account_archive supplied, rows already available archive removed using row-wise anti-join.

title: Validate a generated request (remove weekends, holidays, existing files) — .request_validate
Validate a generated request (remove weekends, holidays, existing files) — .request_validate
text: request_query data.frame tibble produced request_query() containing columns: symbol, start_date, end_date, level. account_archive data.frame tibble, optional provided, rows present archive (matching columns request_query) excluded validation result.

title: Validate a generated request (remove weekends, holidays, existing files) — .request_validate
text: filtered tibble containing valid trading days weekends, NYSE holidays, already present account_archive.

what: Create a LOBSTER data request (one row per trading day) — request_query
title: Create a LOBSTER data request (one row per trading day) — request_query
text: Construct request describing trading-day files ask LOBSTER . symbol date range function expands range one row per calendar day, converts level integer, (optionally) validates requested days removing weekends, NYSE holidays days already present provided account archive.

title: Create a LOBSTER data request (one row per trading day) — request_query
code: request_query(   symbol,   start_date,   end_date,   level,   validate = TRUE,   account_archive = NULL,   frequency = "1 day" )

title: Create a LOBSTER data request (one row per trading day) — request_query
text: symbol character vector One ticker symbols (e.g. "AAPL"). element paired corresponding elements start_date, end_date level. Recycling follows base R rules; mismatched lengths avoided. start_date Date-like (Date character) Start date(s) requested range(s). start date converted .Date(). end_date Date-like (Date character) End date(s) requested range(s). end date converted .Date(). level integer(1) Required order-book snapshot level (e.g. 1, 2). validate logical(1) TRUE (default) remove weekend days NYSE holidays — account_archive supplied — remove days already present account archive. account_archive data.frame tibble, optional Archive table returned account_archive(). provided, rows match (symbol, start_date, end_date, level, size, download, id) excluded returned request. frequency character(1), defaults "1 day". Frequency string passed request data. large data ranges, may beneficial request data lower frequency, e.g. "1 month" reduce number requests lobster server.

title: Create a LOBSTER data request (one row per trading day) — request_query
text: tibble (data.frame) one row per trading day columns: symbol: character start_date: Date end_date: Date (equal start_date daily requests) level: integer function returns days remain optional validation.

title: Create a LOBSTER data request (one row per trading day) — request_query
text: function perform network activity. Use request_submit() send generated requests authenticated LOBSTER session.

title: Create a LOBSTER data request (one row per trading day) — request_query
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Single symbol, one-month range req <- request_query("AAPL", "2020-01-01", "2020-01-31", level = 2)  # Multiple symbols / ranges (vectorised inputs) req <- request_query(   symbol = c("AAPL", "MSFT"),   start_date = c("2020-01-01", "2020-02-01"),   end_date = c("2020-01-03", "2020-02-03"),   level = c(1, 1) ) } # }

what: Submit one or more requests to an authenticated LOBSTER account — request_submit
title: Submit one or more requests to an authenticated LOBSTER account — request_submit
text: Send prepared request rows lobsterdata.com using authenticated session contained account_login. row request submitted separate request. function performs network side effects returns invisibly.

title: Submit one or more requests to an authenticated LOBSTER account — request_submit
Submit one or more requests to an authenticated LOBSTER account — request_submit
text: account_login list Output account_login() contains successful authenticated session (valid == TRUE) submission response required navigation. request data.frame tibble returned request_query() columns: symbol, start_date, end_date, level.

title: Submit one or more requests to an authenticated LOBSTER account — request_submit
text: Invisibly returns NULL. primary effect submit requests remote service; responses returned function.

title: lobsteR 0.1.0
text: Initial CRAN submission.
